content:
@larsdesigns when you get a chance can you have a look see at this: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/677

[DX] Updte sql-dump-sanitize to add a *-latest.sql.gz and *-latest.tar.gz for automatic downloading feature. · Issue #677 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
@larsdesigns Can you update the sql-dump-sanitize script to either latest master or this tag https://github.com/serundeputy/sql-dump-sanitize/releases/tag/1.1.0 update the cron jobs for files and d...
@larsdesigns ++
larsdesigns GG (Karma: 1)
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) Can you test and see if it is working as expected?
it is thanks so much!
@larsdesigns ++
larsdesigns :pancakes: (Karma: 2)
Okay, awesome.
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) , Perhaps I can configure a git pull cron job so that you can push to it whenever you like using the master branch?
that would be fine
we should document that in the README.md so we don't forget and cause sadness
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy), I think that would be good. Let me check with the powers that be and I will make it so.
@jenlampton ^^
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) Would every 2 minutes be okay?
yes; is that too much overhead?
I see other jobs for 5 minutes.
kk
I will go with that precedent.
It is done. @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) would you like to test it?
Update the readme file?
no i'm scared;
*now
yeah
you wanna just update the README.md and see if that takes?
yes
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) Let me know when you are done.
Zulip is a little unusual but I am learning to like it.
just pushed up a change
Looks good to me commit 24454586c776145261137a007eeaadadd98b5ee2
nice;
@larsdesigns I don't think we should use the master branch, that sounds too dangerous. Can you have it pull the latest stable release instead?
also @larsdesigns checking for updates every 5 mins is extreme for something that only changes a few times a year. Checking once per day is more than enough.
I added that into the ticket, but since the ticket was for something unrelated (and is now closed) let me know if you want another one?
@jenlampton okay, I will make the changes.
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) ++
(serundeputy)** :grinning: :heart: (Karma: 11)
@larsdesigns ++
larsdesigns Cheers (Karma: 3)
@jenlampton ++
jenlampton :pancakes: (Karma: 4)
/me nods at @klonos
how many folks are using lando for dev on backdropcms.org?

If you are this https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/678 will allow you to lando pulldb and get the latest sanitized backup piped into your lando app

[DX] Add lando tooling to easily grab latest sanitized db. · Issue #678 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
In #677 we added the symlink to the latest database backup. In this issue let's add tooling to automate grabbing the latest backup and piping it into our local backdropcms.org lando app. PR: #679
Ooh ooh, me! :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
How would one get an account on api.backdropcms.org?
I am going to work on change records for the 2 cache tickets in the 1.16 milestone.
Not sure what the rules are for who gets an account. Not sure there are any rules. If @jenlampton @Nate Lampton OK with it I can add you.
@docwilmot i'd say it's fine and desirable to add an account for @Joseph Flatt
@docwilmot ++
docwilmot Cheers (Karma: 7)
@Joseph Flatt ++
flatt** great work (Karma: 1)
@Joseph Flatt did you get added yet?
ohhp; i can not add accounts just see them;
I have not been added as far as I know.
i thought i could do it, but I can't :(

There are no rules. Once we can get SSO working everyone can have an
account!
@jenlampton Hybridauth module may do the job for sso. Haven't tested GitHub login yet but have Google login working on a dev site.
We're using bakery.

I would say not everyone should get an account ...unless we want to implement the same model of only being able to create drafts - not publish. It just feels that the API site should be by invite/request only.

Is this the issue for getting SSO working on *.backdropcms.org, or is there another one?: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/332

set up bakery module so cookies can be shared across all *.backdropcms.org sites · Issue #332 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We want to have one master set of user account data. This will include email address, username, and password, but also all other profile data collected on bacldropcms.org. Users should be able to l...

I also found:

  • https://github.com/backdrop-ops/forum.backdropcms.org/issues/21
  • https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/178

The latter one could affect or be affected by *.backdropcms.org SSO, but I didn't read through the issue to understand its purpose.

Better Bakery UX · Issue #21 · backdrop-ops/forum.backdropcms.org
I think we should solve the bakery UX problem mentioned here the same way d.o did. Only let's include our fix in the Backdrop Bakery module, and if possible provide a patch back to the d.o issu...
Allow single-sign-on with GitHub · Issue #178 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We would like to allow people to sign on from GitHub, so existing GitHub users do not need to create new accounts on backdropcms.org. This will also allow backdrop contributors an additional level ...
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) Yep, one of those :smiley:

Something pretty weird going on on BackdropCMS.org. Seems relatively serious, since quite a few modules are not showing up in search at all, even if you search their exact name.

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/755

Some contrib modules are not displaying properly on b.org · Issue #755 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
I have been finding that some modules are NOT showing up on the modules page AND the download link is not showing up on their Backdropcms.org page. For example: https://backdropcms.org/project/bloc...
I think we may need to schedule an infrastructure sprint sometime soon!

Ping @jenlampton https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/635

Create new Backdrop NameCheap account and transfer all domains into it · Issue #635 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
It's come up several times that it is a problem that only one person has access to DNS for Backdrop properties. In order to move this forward I am going to create a new NameCheap account so tha...
User profiles on BackdropCMS.org now list all projects a user is/has been involved with! image.png
How is the list generated actually?

This is really nice! Thanks for adding that!

Any chance of adding "has submitted a PR on the module" to the inclusion criteria?
Related: is there any way to generate a list of projects which are on GH but haven't had a release? Just realised, seeing my list, that there are a few that I worked on but never released.

By the way, some account pages seem to be spam holders, for example:
https://backdropcms.org/account/vipsbobet88
https://backdropcms.org/account/studiokristo
https://backdropcms.org/account/tecocraftpvt
https://backdropcms.org/account/purencool
https://backdropcms.org/account/vedaoils

How is the list generated actually?

If the user profile has a GitHub username (in the Social field), it uses that. Otherwise it uses the normal username field. It then searches for that username in the Body field of project nodes on B.org and returns matching results.

Any chance of adding "has submitted a PR on the module" to the inclusion criteria?

Not with the current implementation, but it might be possible if we re-wrote it to use GitHub's API instead... I recommend opening an issue if you want to investigate that option.

Related: is there any way to generate a list of projects which are on GH but haven't had a release? Just realised, seeing my list, that there are a few that I worked on but never released.

I'm not sure. I have a list of projects I maintain on GitHub because I've 'watched' them. But I had to do this manually because I couldn't find another way to get this list automatically. Maybe there's a way with GitHub's API to find a list of repos where you've been given Admin access...
